result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian S O'Toole was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault) [Modifiers: Persistent Repeater], a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.025(1)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

THE DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS SHALL DEDUCT RESTITUTION AND ALL OTHER COURT OBLIGATIONS AT THE RATE OF 25% OF ALL MONIES RECEIVED WHILE INCARCERATED.

904 am case called. Appearances made. 
Defendant Brian S O'Toole in court, in custody, with attorney Thomas Brady Aquino. Attorney Diane M. Donohoo in court for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin. Attorney Travis Schwantes in court.
Defendant's Postconviction Motion regarding jury instruction conference. Atty Aquino makes record as to motion. 
Response by Attorney Schwantes. 
Continued argument by Atty Aquino. 
Objection by ADA Donohoo.
Continued argument by parties. 
Arguments preserved for appeal. 
Court denies motion for new trial. 
Court finds there was no due process violation for Sullivan analysis.
931 am court in recess.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brian S O'Toole in court, in custody with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court in session @ 2:00 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for sentencing hearing. Court asks ADA Donohoo if victim's rights have been complied with. ADA Donohoo makes a record. GAL Andrew Walter wishes to make a statement to the Court on behalf of the victim's best interest and not on behalf of the victim. Objection by Atty. Schwantes for the record as to GAL making a statement. Court overrules and will hear from Atty. Walter. 
2:05 p.m. - Statement to the Court by Atty. Walter. 
2:07 p.m. - Argument by ADA Donohoo, emphasizing Court's lack of discretion as to the length of sentence, and asks Court to sentence defendant to the maximum per statutes and Court of Appeals case that is comparable. ADA Donohoo refers to exhibit #9 (judgment of conviction from prior conviction). 
2:13 p.m. - Argument by Atty. Schwantes
2:18 p.m. - The Defendant does not wish to make a statement to the Court.
2:18 p.m. - Court makes a record as to applicability of persistent repeater allegation (Collins). Court supplement record as to other factors/guidelines for sentencing in this matter. Court finds that out of state prior conviction is comparable for persistent repeater statute, and also finds that the Court has no discretion as to sentence. 

Court sentences the defendant to LIFE in prison. 

Court admonishes the defendant as to deportation, voting rights, body armor, weapons.

ADA Donohoo has nothing further
Atty. Schwantes has nothing further.

Court recess @ 2:27 p.m.

**10/28/2016 - Excerpt Transcript and complete Transcript of Sentencing hearing FILED.  (df)
of Partial Proceedings (Jury Trial, Day (1) held on July 11, 2016
Alternate List
Guilty of Repeated sexual assaults involving the same child
Exhibits stored in exhibit room

BAILIFFS:  Jim Haraldsen, Bob Nitka and Diane Mullins
Clerk:  feefee
8:32 am  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deft Brian S O'Toole in court, in custody with Atty Travis Schwantes.   
State filed a Memo regarding a Patino closing argument and the Defense filed a responding e-mail.  
8:34 am  Argument by Atty Donohoo.  
8:36 am  Argument by Atty Schwantes.  
Continued discussion between Court and Attys. 
8:50 am  Court finds that it is the law that the deft may compel people to testify and the Jury is entitled to know that.  Further discussion between Court and Attys regarding the doctor's records.  Court will allow the argument with respect to the records also.  
8:52 am  Court has provided the Attys with a copy of the jury instruction packet.  
8:53 am  Atty Schwantes has an issue with the lesser included Instruction.  Argument by Atty Schwantes.  
8:59 am  Response by Atty Donohoo.  
9:00 am  Court is going to allow a lesser included offense for the reasons stated on the record.  
9:00 am  Court takes recess and will resume at 9:30 am  

9:11 am  Court in session with jury seated in courtroom.  
9:11 am  Court releases the 2 alternate Jurors at this time (#5265 and #1428)
9:12 am  Court Instructs the Jury.  
9:28 am  Closing argument by Atty Donohoo.  
10:21 am  Closing argument by Atty Schwantes.  
11:17 am  Court in recess and will resume at 11:30 am  

11:31 am  Court in session.  Jury seated in courtroom.  
11:31 am  Rebuttal argument by Atty Donohoo.  
11:43 am  Court gives further Instructions to Jurors.  
11:45 am  Clerk gives Oath to Bailiffs.  
11:47 am  Jury is excused from courtroom to begin their deliberations.  
11:47 am  No objection by Attys to reading of the Instructions.  
11:47 am  Court in recess. 
CLERKS CHANGE: K. OLSON, B FIEGEL
Court exhibit 1 marked previously.
1:09 pm Court in session.  Appearances remain the same.  Jury remains outside the presence of the Court.  Court gives copies of jury question (Court Exhibit 1) to both attorneys.
1:10 pm Court asks for both attorneys interpretation of what should be provided to the jury.  Statement by Atty Donohoo.  Response by Atty Schwantes.  
1:12 pm Discussion between Court and attorneys.  
1:15 pm Court suggests providing jury pages 7-13 of transcript of interview with Paula Hocking.  Atty Donohoo requests pages 7-24 inclusive.  Court proposes entire transcript be provided with redactions.  Atty Schwantes makes a statement preserving his objection to providing the jury the transcript.  
1:20 pm Court response to Atty Schwantes' objection.  
1:22 pm Response by Atty Donohoo.  
1:23 pm Court in recess for Judge to prepare typed response to the jury.  
1:26 pm Court presents response to the attorneys.  Provides Bailiff Heraldson the response from the Court to present to the jury.
1:27 pm Court in recess.  
Court exhibit 2 marked off the record.  
1:31 pm Court on the record to memorialize the jury will be receiving a redacted copy of the transcript requested.  
1:31 pm Court in recess.  
1:35 pm Court prepares response to Court exhibit 2 and provides copies to attorneys and Bailiff Heraldson to provide to the jury.
1:35 pm Court in recess.  
2:15 pm Court in session.  Appearances remain the same.  Jury remains outside the presence of the Court.  Jury provided with redacted version of transcript of itnerview with Paula Hocking in response to Court Exhibit 2.  Court clarifies that pages 20 and 24 are redacted in their entirty.  Court provides Bailiff Heraldson with the redacted copy to present to the jury.
2:17 pm Court in recess.  
2:52 pm Court in session.  Appearances remain the same.  Jury seated in the courtroom.  A verdict has been obtained.
2:53 pm Verdict is read aloud.  Guilty.  All jurors polled.  This is and was their verdict.
2:56 pm Jury dismissed.  
2:57 pm Statement by Atty Donohoo regarding verdict/ sentencing.
2:58 pm Statement by Atty Schwantes.  
3:00 pm Response by Atty Donohoo.  
3:00 pm Court requests Ms. Los, Victim Witness Coordinator, confer with the victim as to her wishes regarding sentencing.
3:02 pm Bail is revoked and Mr. O'Toole is remand to the Sheriff.  
3:04 pm Victim wishes to be present for sentencing.  
3:04 pm SPD Schwantes is given until July 28, 2016 to brief, ADA Donohoo is given until Aug 15, 2016.
3:06 pm Sentencing hearing set for August 29, 2016 @ 2:00pm
3:08 pm Court in recess.
*TRANSCRIPT FILED 12/08/2016 : Court Reporter: Sandra Elderbrook (ko)
E-mail Response from Atty Schwantes to State's Memo Regarding Patino Closing Argument
State's Memo Regarding a Patino Closing Argument

BAILIFFS:  Jim Haraldsen, Bob Nitka and Diane Mullins
Clerk:  feefee
8:24 am  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deft Brian S O'Toole in court, in custody with Atty Travis Schwantes.   
Discussion between Court and Attys concerning issues related to 904.04(2)(b)2.  
Atty Donohoo did file additional Jury Instructions with the Court.  
Atty Donohoo has prepared a new 275 Jury Instruciton.  
8:44 am  Deborah Ewoldt is sworn and testifies on cross exam by Atty Schwantes.  Exhibit 12 marked and identified as report of Ms. Ewoldt
8:49 am  Objection by DA Donohoo.  
8:49 am  Atty Schwantes asks to be heard outside presence of Jury.  Jury excused from courtroom.  
8:49 am  Argument by Atty Schwantes. 
8:54 am  Atty Donohoo suggests an offer of proof.  
8:54 am  Response by Ms. Ewoldt to Court's question.  
8:55 am  Response by Ms. Ewoldt to questions of Atty Schwantes as an offer of proof.  
8:56 am  Argument by Atty Donohoo.  Response by Atty Schwantes.  
8:59 am  Continued discussion between Court and Attys.  
9:02 am  Court goes off record while Court Reporter looks for Ms. Ewoldt's testimony from yesterday. 
9:05 am  Court is back on the record.  Court Reporter has identified that portion of the transcript that the parties have been talking about.  Continued discussion between Court and Attys.  
9:18 am  Exhibit 9, certified copy of IL JOC, is offered by the State and received into evidence.  
9:19 am  Continued offer of proof.  Response by Ms. Ewoldt to Atty Schwantes' questions.  
9:22 am  Response by Ms. Ewoldt to Atty Donohoo's questions.  
9:23 am  Continued discussion between Court and Attys.  Atty Schwantes will decline to ask further questions of the witness.  Neither Atty is offering Exhibit 12 into evidence.  Court will receive Exhibit 12 ONLY for purposes of making it part of the record.  
9:27 am  Court takes short 5 minute break.  
9:31 am  Jury seated in Courtroom.  Court makes record it is going to strike the last question that Mr. Schwantes asked.  Attys have no further question of Ms. Ewoldt.    
9:32 am  Paula Hocking is sworn and testifes on direct exam of Atty Donohoo.  
Exhibit 13 marked and identified as CV of Ms. Hocking.  Exhibit 13 is offered and received.  
10:03 am  Cross exam by Atty Schwantes.  
10:28 am  Court takes recess.  
10:49 am  Jury seated in courtroom.  Continued cross of Ms. Hocking by Atty Schwantes.  
10:54 am  Redirect by Atty Donohoo.  
11:16 am  Recross by Atty Schwantes.  
11:17 am  Witness excused.  
11:18 am  Jury is excused for lunch and asked to return at 1:00 pm
11:19 am  Continued discussion between Court and Attys relating to the 2005 Illinois Statute.  Atty Schwantes confirms that the copy provided by Atty Donohoo is from the 2005 Illinois Statutes.  
11:27 am  Court in recess.  
11:43 am  Court in session with Attys and Deft.  Atty Schwantes has reviewed the case submitted by Atty Donohoo.  Court is in session at this time to determine whether the statute in Illinois that Mr O'Toole was convicted of as shown in Exhibit #9 is comparable to a violation of Sec. 948.02(1), Wis. Stats.   Exhibit 14, A copy of the 2005 Illinois Statute is marked and received into evidence by the Court.  Court hears argument of Attorneys.  12:01 pm  Court makes findings / record.  Response by Atty Schwantes.  Court indicates that the question is whether it is a comparable offense in another jurisdiction, and the Court believes it is.  Court believes that 904.04(2)(b)2. has been met.  Court believes proposed Instruction by Atty Donohoo is a legitimate compromise.  Court is inclined to use the latest Instruction #275 proposed by the State.  12:08 pm  Argument by Atty Schwantes asking Court to reconsider its position.  12:11 pm  Court makes further record, and Court is not changing its decision.  Atty Schwantes believes the best Instruction to give is the standard Instruction on 275.  He sees no need to modify the Instruction that exists.  12:13 pm  Response by Atty Donohoo.  She will prepare a revised Instruction.  12:15 pm  Continued discussion between Court and Attys.  Atty Schwantes would like the Instruction given before the next witness.  12:18 pm  Court in recess.  
Court in sesson @ 1:01 p.m. with same appearances.
CLERK: Lori S.
Atty. Schwantes makes a record that he does not want the cautionary instruction read until after evidence is presented. Response by the Court. Response by Atty. Schwantes. Court will read instruction after testimony. Court addresses exhibit #9, and how to read to the jury. Response by ADA Donohoo. Response by the Court. Response by  Atty. Schwantes that he wishes it be introduced into evidence.
1:05 p.m. - Jury seated in jury box. Court explains that exhibit #9 has been received and informs the jury what the exhibit is.
1:07 p.m. - State calls Lori Nora, who is duly sworn and responds to direct exam of ADA Donohoo
1:20 p.m. - Cross exam by Atty. Schwantes. Exhibit #15 marked, identified, and testified to by the witness.
1:25 p.m. - Witness is excused.
1:25 p.m. - State calls Nicholle Benson who is duly sworn and responds to direct exam of ADA Donohoo
No cross. Witness excused @ 1:38 p.m.
1:38 p.m. State calls Barry Portman who is duly sworn and repsonds to direct exam of ADA Donohoo. Exhibit #16 marked, identified, and testified to by the witness. State moves exhibit #16 into evidence. No objection. Exhibit received.
1:56 p.m. - Cross exam by Attorney Schwantes
Witness excused @ 2:13 p.m.
Court in recess until 2:30 for afternoon break

2:30 pm  Court in session.  Jury not present.  Court has discussion with Attys off the record.  
2:30 pm  Court in session with Jury seated in courtroom.  
2:31 pm  Desiree O'Toole is sworn and testifies on exam of Atty Donohoo.  
Exhibit 11 - Order of protection - offered and received.  
Exhibit 5 - calendar from 2005 - is offered and received.  
No cross examination.  
3:07 pm  State rests.  Jury excused from courtroom.  
Court has colloquy with defendant as to his constitutional right to testify or not testify.  Response by Atty Schwantes to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant's decision to testifiy has been made knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently.  Court takes recess and will resume at 3:30 pm
3:31 pm  Jury seated in courtroom.  
Brian S. O'Toole testifies on direct exam of Atty Schwantes.  
Exhibit 17 - photo of deft and his family - offered, received and published
Exhibit 18 - photo of deft and Haley - offered, received and published  
Exhibit 19 - photos of deft and Haley - offered, received and published  
Exhibit 20 - photos of deft and Haley - offered, received and published
Exhibit 21 - photos of deft and Haley - offered, received and published
Cross exam by Atty Donohoo
Redirect by Atty Schwantes
Recross exam by Atty Donohoo.
Exhibit 22 - letter sent by deft to Brittany - offered and received.  
Court has sidebar with Attys to discuss further scheduling. 
Defense has no further witness.  State has no rebuttal witnesses.  
5:22 pm  Jurors excused for the day.  
5:25 pm  Court in recess.  

**11/15/2016 - Transcript FILED;  Court Reporter:  Janet Schulz  (df)

BAILIFFS:  Jim Haraldsen, Bob Nitka and Diane Mullins
A.M. Clerk: Lori S. 
Defendant Brian S O'Toole in court, in custody with attorney Travis Schwantes and Julia May.  Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court in session @ 8:29 a.m. Appearances made. Court makes a record as to emails from the attorneys it received yesterday. Record by ADA Donohoo regarding facial expressions of people in the Courtroom to the testimony of victim.  Court instructs mothers in courtroom to keep facial expressions blank. 
8:33 a.m. - Jury seated in jury box. Victim, HMFM is sworn and responds to continued direct exam of ADA Donohoo. Objection to line of questioning as to hearsay. Argument by both parties. 
8:44 a.m. - Court excuses jury to allow parties further discussion/argument. Court finds that questioning is laying foundation for prior inconsistent statements and will allow questioning.
9:07 a.m. - Court in recess to take short break.
9:15 a.m. - Court in session with same appearances. Court makes a record regarding 972.09 and witness testimony and inquires of the State if that is where they are at. Response by ADA Donohoo. State is not considering witness as adverse at this time. Response by Attorney Schwantes. Atty. Schwantes makes a record that it has come to the parties' attention, that the victim's mother is making facial expressions and seems to be nodding or shaking her head during testimony. Response by the Court. Response by ADA Donohoo that she also believes that mother should be removed from court room during victim's testimony. Based upon motion of both parties, Court removes Mother from the courtroom and instructs her that she may not speak about this case during the remainder of the trial with the victim.
9:21 a.m. - Jury seated in jury box. Court informs jury that defense objection is overruled and questioning may continue. Direct exam continues by ADA Donohoo
9:29 a.m. - Cross exam by Attorney Schwantes. Exhibit #1 marked, identified, and testified to by the witness. Atty. Schwantes moves exhibit #1 into evidence. No objection. Exhibit received. Exhibit #2 - pg 3 of transcript marked, identified, and testified to by the witness. Exhibit moved into evidence by stipulation. Exhibit received.
10:24 a.m. - Court takes short recess
10:40 a.m. - Court back in session with same appearances. Cross exam of HMFM continues by Atty. Schwantes.
11:07 a.m. - Redirect by ADA Donohoo. Exhibit #3 marked, identified, and testified to by the witness. State moves Exhibit #3 into evidence. No objection. Exhibit received.
11:27 a.m. - Recross by Attorney Schwantes
11:30 a.m. - Redirect by ADA Donohoo
11:32 a.m. - Recross by Attorney Schwantes
11:34 a.m. - Witness excused
11:34 a.m. - State calls Officer Brad Schroeder who is duly sworn and responds to direct exam of ADA Donohoo. Exhibit #4 marked, identified, and testified to by the witness. Exhibit #4 moved into evidence by the Court and received with no objection. Exhibit #5 marked, identified, and testified to by the witness. 
11:48 a.m. - Court excuses jury for lunch. Parties discuss/argue objection regarding hearsay by Atty. Schwantes outside presence of the jury. Court makes a record and addresses the parties as to argument. Argument/response by ADA Donohoo. Argument by Attorney Schwantes. Witness responds to Court's questions. Atty. Schwantes supplements his argument, and record. Response by the Court.
11:55 a.m. - Court in recess for lunch. Parties to return at 1:10 p.m. for Court's ruling on objection.
1:10 p.m. - Court in session with same appearances. Court addresses Atty. Schwantes' objection regarding testimony prior to lunch. The Court has reviewed Blinka and makes a record as to its findings, and will allow witness to answer questions regarding mother's demeanor. Atty. Schwantes makes a record that over lunch hour he received a text from Mary O'Toole asking whether she can be back in the courtroom now that victim is done testifying. Court affirms its ruling was as to victim's testimony. Response by ADA Donohoo that she may still be a witness, and is not comfortable with her presence in the courtroom due to her continued conversations about what is happening in the courtroom. Court makes a record and rules that he will need to have a discussion with Ms. O'Toole prior to allowing her back in the courtroom. Response by Atty. Schwantes.
1:18 p.m. - Jury is seated in jury box. Direct exam of Officer Schroeder by ADA Donohoo continues.
1:21 p.m. - Cross exam by Attorney Schwantes
1:24 p.m. - Redirect by ADA Donohoo.
Witness excused @ 1:25 p.m.
1:25 p.m. - State calls Jeannie Endgerson who is duly sworn and responds to direct exam of ADA Donohoo. Exhibits #6 & #7 marked, identified, and testified to by the witness. State moves Exhibit #6 into evidence. Objection by Atty. Schwantes, who requests to argue outside the jury. Court will rule on objection at next break. Direct exam continues. ADA Donohoo requests Court take Judicial Notice of former ADA Powell's employment as original prosecutor on this case.  State moves exhibit #7 into evidence. Objection by Attorney Schwantes who would like to argue outside the presence of the jury.
1:51 p.m. - Court excuses jury. Prior to getting into objections to exhibits. ADA requests to make a record as to questions by Atty. Schwantes to prior witness and her position regarding waiving hearsay. Atty. Schwantes argues as to exhibits in question. Response by ADA Donohoo. Parties respond to Court's questions and continued argument by both parties. ADA Donohoo responds to Court's specific questions regarding objections to the exhibits, who agrees that exhibits would have to be redacted if they are published to the jury, and that. 
2:20 p.m. - Attorney Schwantes responds to Court's questions.
2:22 p.m. - Response by ADA Donohoo as to lack of timeliness of objections.
2:24 p.m. - Atty. Schwantes makes a record that as long as exhibit #6 does not go to the jury, he does not believe that he will be harmed, but supplements his record as to statements made by ADA Donohoo yesterday that also raised an issues as to time frame of alleged abuse. 
2:26 p.m. - Court finds objection by Attorney Schwantes is not timely and overrules. Court also admonishes the State as to referring to time frames outside the charging documents. Court is willing to read specific instruction to the jury as well. Atty. Schwantes does request the Court to read specific instruction as to times of offense in charging documents. 
2:28 p.m. - Court in recess @ 2:29 for afternoon break.
2:44 p.m. - Court back in session with same appearances. Court addresses Mary O'Toole as to behaviors in the courtroom and concerns by the parties. Court admonishes Ms. O'Toole that if any these behaviors or discussion of this case continue, she will be removed from the courtroom and may impose further sequestration rules. Attorney Schwantes withdraws his objection as to exhibit #6 based upon record made prior to the break. Exhibit #6 received with redactions as to time frame of two (2) years. Atty. Schwantes supplements his argument as to exhibit #7. Response by ADA Donohoo regarding her intent as to exhibit #7. Response by Atty. Schwantes. Response by Court. Response by Atty. Schwantes that his objections are in regard to statements made by Ms. O'Toole and other witness and if they are redacted and do not go back to the jury, he has no other objections. Response by the Court. ADA Donohoo responds to clarification questions as to exhibit #7 and what her intent is. Continued discussion/argument. ADA Donohoo goes through each statement that she intends to bring in as to exhibit #7. Response by Atty. Schwantes. Court finds that bullet points pointed out fall under prior inconsistent statements and will allow the questions as to those bullet points only - overuling objections made by Atty. Schwantes. Exhibit #7 received with redactions as ordered.
3:07 p.m. - Jury seated in jury box. Direct exam of witness continues by ADA Donohoo. 
3:12 p.m. - Cross exam by Attorney Schwantes. Exhibit #8 marked, identified, and testified to by the witness. Atty. Schwantes moves exhibit #8 into evidence. No objection. Exhibit received.
3:26 p.m. - Redirect by ADA Donohoo.
Witness excused @ 3:33 p.m.
3:33 p.m. - State calls Deborah Ewoldt who is duly sworn and responds to direct exam of Atty. Donohoo.
3:43 p.m. - Court excuses jury to hear argument regarding Atty. Schwantes' objection based on hearsay. Argument by Atty Schwantes. Argument by ADA Donohoo. Response by Atty Schwantes. Parties respond to Court's questions. Court makes a record and finds that current line of questions and sustains Atty. Schwantes' objection on this question. 
3:56 p.m. - Court makes a record as to witnesses unavailability tomorrow. ADA Donohoo informs the Court that she is almost done with her questions. Court turns to Atty. Schwantes to see how to proceed. Atty. Schwantes has no objection to witness returning on Thursday to finish her testimony. Discussion as to schedule for tomorrow to allow discussion of 904.04 issue prior to jury. Parties to be in Court at 8:15 a.m. Jury to report @ 8:45 a.m. Witness informs the Court that she can make a phone call to see if she can postpone appointments. Witness informs the Court that she can be here tomorrow as long as she leaves by noon. Parties agree that this will work. 
4:01 p.m. - Jury seated in jury box. Court informs the jury that they should report at 8:45 a.m. and the schedule for tomorrow.
Court in recess.

3:02 pm  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Brian S O'Toole in court, in custody with attorney Travis Schwantes.  
Court is going to utilize Atty Donohoo's March 16th letter as a framework for addressing the several concerns.  
Paragraph #1 of Atty Donohoo's letter:  Motion for Offer of Proof // Additional Other Acts Evidence
Atty Schwantes is objecting to the use of the additional other acts evidence.
Argument by Atty Schwantes.  He objects to paragraphs 6a thru 6i coming in at all.  
Atty Donohoo first responds to Atty Schwantes objection to paragraphs 6a thru i.  
With reference to paragraphs A thru LL, the Court believes that the context and background is important for the overall presentation of the case.  Court will allow the testimony.  
Atty Schwantes states he would have the same argument with regard to the other paragraphs.  
Court does not believe the probative value is outweighed by the danger of unfair prejudice.  Court will allow a special jury instruction to be given.
Paragraph #2 of Atty Donohoo's letter:  There is no objection by Atty Schwantes.  
Paragraph #3 and #4 of Atty Donohoo's letter.  
Discussion concerning Atty Schwantes' objection to the language in the proposed Order.  
Atty Schwantes won't be elicit evidence that M. O'Toole hit the complainant.  Atty Schwantes is withdrawing his objection.  
Court signs Order.
  
Paragraph 5 - Discussion between Court and Attys.  Atty Schwantes would admonish Mr. O'Toole that he cannot testify contrary to any court order.  Attorney Donohoo will prepare an Order for this issue. 
Paragraph 6 - Notice of the use of statements of others.  Atty Donohoo indicates this is merely for notice to the defense;  
Paragraph 7 - State confirms all witnesses are available for trial.
Paragraph 8 - Court did review the transcript and the Court can see how it might be confusing.  Court gives clarification to its ruling.  Court believes there would have to be a separate hearing before those questions could be asked of the victim.  Response by Atty Schwantes with regard to an offer of proof he will establish with Mr. O'Toole.  Court believes we would need an evidentiary hearing.  Continued discussion between Court and Attorneys.  Court expresses its concerns.  Court proposes doing evidentiary hearing prior to jury selection.  Court proposes having the Motion hearing set for 8:30 am with the Jury reporting at 1:00 pm   Response by Attorneys to Court's proposal.  
3:36 pm  Court takes 10 minute break at the request of ADA Donohoo.  
3:39 pm  Atty Donohoo has reconsidered her objection and is withdrawing it.  Attorney Schwantes can ask the question of the witness.  
3:40 pm  Atty Donohoo wishes to clarify and makes a record as to why the Illinois case was dismissed.  
Atty Donohoo makes a record with regard to the preliminary hearing scheduled in case 2016CF000109 - because the prelim was scheduled on a speedy basis, the officer was not available for the scheduled date but they can proceed with another officer at next week's hearing.  
3:42 pm  Atty Donohoo will prepare Order.  
3:42 pm  Court in recess.

**Transcript filed 02/06/2017, court reporter Eileen Walsh Grzenia.
Offer of Proof
State's Motion to Admit a Witness Deposition

2:30 pm FINAL PRE-TRIAL CALENDAR:  Defendant Brian S O'Toole in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is before the Court for final pre-trial.  Both sides are ready to proceed to trial.  Attorney Donohoo believes that there may be outstanding Motions that need to be addressed.  Discussion concerning D. Orth case.  Argument by Attorneys.  Attorney Donohoo wants this matter to go forward for trial.  There are witnesses coming from out-of-State.  Court believes that on its face there seems to be a valid issue here that needs to be addressed even if it was under the concept of "reconsideration".  Attorney Donohoo asks that the Court find that it is not relevant but if during the trial there comes a point that it becomes relevant, the Court can re-address this at trial.  Response by Attorney Schwantes.  His recollection is that the State had conceded that introduction of testimony about this complaining witness sending photos is relevant to her bias.  Atty Schwantes objects to this being brought up at final pre-trial without a motion having been filed.  Further argument by Attorney Donohoo.  Court notes that impeachment includes whether a witness possesses a bias and Court makes reference to Blinka.  Court asks "how are you going to get this in?"  Response by Attorney Schwantes.  Continued discussion between Court and Attorneys.  Court will contact the Court reporter from the September 4th motion hearing to get a transcript or a read-back from that hearing.  This case remains on for trial.  Court will keep the parties informed as to what it finds from the court reporter and if need be, we can have a hearing Friday afternoon.  Attorney Donohoo refers Court to the Motion filed in mid May - captioned State's Amended Motion in Limine.  Court does not find an Amended Motion in Limine in the Court file.  Discussion with regard to an incident that happened at a foster home.  Court would prefer that if an issue arises with regard to this incident, that it should be addressed outside the presence of the Jury.  Attorney Donohoo does not believe child's mother is entitled to be present in Court and should be subject to sequestration ruling.  Attorney Donohoo is relying on Sec. 906.15(2)(d).  Court believes the mother has the statutory right to be present in the courtroom.  4:26 p.m.  Court in recess.

**Transcript filed 02/06/2017, court reporter Eileen Walsh Grzenia.

3:33 p.m.  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
Attorney Defendant Brian S. O'Toole in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  
Valerian A Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
When last in in Court on this matter, the Court asked the parties to brief the issue of whether sexting constitutes sexual conduct.  Court has reviewed the Briefs of the parties. 
The State in its Brief had proposed a compromise that the evidence be admitted regarding victim sending inappropriate text without describing the context of the text.  
Attorney Schwantes is not in agreement with this proposal.  
Attorney Powell has further argument.  Response by Attorney Schwantes.  
Continued discussion between Court and Attorneys.  
Court believes we should be looking at sexual conduct under 972.11.  
Response by Attorney Powell that in this case at least it is sexual conduct.  
Attorney Schwantes states that there is a factual dispute as to what the photos were.  
Court makings findings that photo is not sexual conduct under 972.11.  
Discussion between Court and Attorneys.  
Attorney Powell will concede that it can become relevant.  If it is properly developed at trial, it probably is relevant to bias.  Attorney Powell withdraws relevancy objection to an extent.  He believes it should be explored outside jury's presence before aired in open Court.  Continued discussion between Court and Attorney Powell.  Court will allow it.  Response by Attorney Schwantes.  Response by Attorney Powell.  
4:00 p.m.  Court in recess.
